oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Brodie helmet
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The wide-brimmed steel combat helmet with intact leather chinstrap is called a Brodie helmet. It was developed in Great Britain in 1915, and its first combat use was in 1916. the style was copied by the American Army and designated the model 1917. The helmet shows evidence of a unit insignia painted on the front which is undiscernable. The helmet belonged to Cpl. Isaac Ferrell Dixon, HQ Co., 329 Inf. Regt., 83rd Div. Dixon was from Defeated, Smith County, Tennessee.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
